componentsMeta.description: An avatar is a visual representation of a user or entity. It can be used to display an initials, icon, or image.
componentsMeta.name: Avatar

usage.description: The image if provided is displayed first, followed by the icon if provided, and finally the initials. If no initials are provided, the first two letters of the name will be used as initials.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the person or entity represented by the avatar. This is used for accessibility purposes.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the avatar.

properties.name: color
properties.description: The color of the avatar.

properties.name: initials
properties.description:
The initials to display in the avatar limited to 2 characters.

If not provided, the first two letters of the name will be used as initials.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The icon to display in the avatar. This needs to be an icon from the

properties.name: image
properties.description: The url to the image to display in the avatar.

properties.name: showTooltip
properties.description: Whether to show the represeneetd user's name as a tooltip.

properties.name: children
properties.description: The content to render in the portal.

properties.name: container
properties.description: The container to render the portal in.

properties.name: placement
properties.description: The placement of the tooltip.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The tooltip content.

properties.name: children
properties.description: A single element that will trigger the tooltip when hovered over.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Determines if the tooltip is disabled.

properties.name: showTail
properties.description: Determines if the tooltip should hide the tail.

properties.name: placement
properties.description:
The preferred placement of the floating element.

This determines where the floating element will be positioned relative to the reference element.

properties.name: arrowRef
properties.description: A ref object for the arrow element.

properties.name: strategy
properties.description:
The positioning strategy ('absolute' or 'fixed').

When set to 'fixed', the floating element will be positioned relative to the viewport.

When set to 'absolute', the floating element will be positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor.

properties.name: offsetOptions
properties.description: The offset options for the floating element.

properties.name: refWidth
properties.description:
When set to true, the width of the floating element will match the width of the reference element.

When set to an HTMLElement, the width of the floating element will match the width of that HTMLElement.

properties.name: hide
properties.description: Whether to hide the floating element.
